physical_appearance: This is a batik kain panjang. The panel on the right features a dense foliage background, decorated with branches of flowers. There is a diagonal band of scrolling floral patterns across the panel. The main body of the batik features similar floral branches. The flower motif is accompanied by a row of animals such as peacock, fish, and deer along the bottom, and flying phoenixes and butterflies above. There is a signature at the top-left of the batik kain panjang.
sgcool_label_text: "This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Djien Nio (1929-1987), the last in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  In her earlier signatures, she used her husband’s name, Liem Siok Hien.  But from 1965 onwards, she used Jane Hendromartono, combining her husband’s new Indonesian family name, Hendromartono with Jane, as people addressed her by.  She developed a personal style distinct from her mother and grandmother, and experimented with a wide spectrum of colours and exotic combinations of birds, rock formations and mythical animals.  Jane Hendromartono’s clientele expanded beyond the elite in Indonesia to include Europe, America and Japan, especially in the 1980s.  This piece is signed “Jane Hendromartono Pekalongan, Java""."
subject_terms_2: Batik Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people) Motifs
